==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|白|勺|c1=s|c2=p|t1=white|ls=psc}}.

The original form was {{zh-l|*旳}} with the meaning of “bright”, hence the initial {{zh-l|*日}} semantic. See Etymology 1 below.

===Etymology 1===
“Bright”. Compare {{zh-l|*灼}} and {{zh-l|*旳}}.

The sense of “mark in a target” may be secondary. Alternatively, it may be an independent root on its own. Compare {{cog|bo|རྟགས||mark, sign}}.

===Etymology 2===
This glyph was borrowed later to represent ''de'', the possessive marker in Northern Chinese, which resulted from the lenition of the literary possessive marker {{och-l|之}}. Superseded the earlier {{zh-l|*底}} for this meaning. {{lang|zh|之}} is still preserved in many phrases, and in written languages to some extent, especially in Taiwan.

Cognate with the particle sense of {{zh-l|*地}} and {{zh-l|*得}}, which are all homophonic but now have their respective specialised usages.

Compare the stylized Zhuyin variant of {{lang|zh|的}} in Taiwan: {{zh-l|*ㄉ}}.

In contemporary times it is also used to represent unrelated equivalent particles in other Chinese varieties. Examples include Min Nan ''ê'' ({{zh-l|*个}}, {{zh-l|*亓}}, {{zh-l|*兮}} or {{zh-l|*ㄟ}}, derived from {{zh-l|*個}}), Min Dong ''gì'' ({{zh-l|*其}}), Wu ''geq'' ({{zh-l|*個}}) and Cantonese ''ge3'' ({{zh-l|嘅}} < {{zh-l|*個}}).

Languages in the East Asian Sprachbund share a common possessive structure; compare {{etyl|ja|-}} {{ja-r|の}}, {{etyl|ko|-}} {{ko-l|의}}, {{cog|bo|གི}}.

# {{n-g|Used after an attribute. Indicates that the previous word has [[possessive|possession]] of the next one. In English it functions like [['s|’s]] (or like the word “[[of]]” but with the position of [[possessor]] and [[possessee]] switched).}} [['s|’s]]; [[of]]
#: {{zh-x|我 的 書|'''my''' book}}
#* {{zh-x|這 本 書 是 老 王{Wáng} 的。|This book is Wang'''’s'''.}}
#* {{zh-x|今天 開會 是 你 的 主席。|You will chair today's meeting.}}
#* {{zh-x|別 開 他 的 玩笑 了。|Don't make fun of him.}}
#* {{zh-x|蛇 的 毒|the snake'''’s''' poison}}
#* {{zh-x|眾人 的 國家|the People'''’s''' Country}}
# {{n-g|Used to link a noun, an adjective or a phrase to a noun to describe it.}} [[that]]; [[who]]
#: {{zh-x|紅色 的 氣球|a red balloon}}
#* {{zh-x|鐵 的 紀律|iron discipline}}
#* {{zh-x|去 ^北京 的 火車|The train '''that''' goes to Beijing}}
#* {{zh-x|昨天 來 的 人|The people '''who''' came yesterday}}
# {{n-g|Used to form a noun phrase or nominal expression.}}
#* {{zh-x|的話|''particle put at the end of a conditional clause''}}
#* {{zh-x|我 愛 吃 辣 的。|I like hot (or peppery) food.}}
#* {{zh-x|菊花 開 了，有 紅 的，有 黃 的。|The chrysanthemums are in bloom; some are red and some yellow.}}
#* {{zh-x|他 說 他 的，我 幹{gàn} 我 的。|Let him say what he likes; I'll just get on with my work.}}
#* {{zh-x|火車 上 看 書 的 看 書，聊天 的 聊天。|On the train some people were reading and some were chatting.}}
#* {{zh-x|我 要 兩 個 三 毛 的。|I want two of the three-cent ones. (i.e. two items worth three cents each)}}
#* {{zh-x|無緣無故 的 你，著[着]{zháo} 什麼 急？|Why do you get excited for no reason at all?}}
#* {{zh-x|這裡 用 不 著[着]{zháo} 你，你 只管 睡 你 的 去。|We don't need you here. Just go to bed.}}
# {{n-g|Used after a verb or between a verb and its object to stress an element of the sentence. It can be used with {{zh-l|是}} to surround the stressed element.}}
#* {{zh-x|誰 買 的？|Who bought it?}}
#* {{zh-x|你 嗓子 怎麼 啞 了？——^唱 的。|Why are you so hoarse? —From singing.}}
#* {{zh-x|是 我 打 的 稿子{zi}，他 上 的 色。|It was I who worked up the sketch and he who filled in the colours.}}
#* {{zh-x|他 是 昨天 進 的 城。|He went to town yesterday. (It's yesterday that he went to town)}}
#* {{zh-x|我 是 在 車站 打 的 票。|I bought the ticket at the station. (It's in the station that I bought the ticket)}}
# {{n-g|Used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis.}}
#* {{zh-x|你們 這 兩 天 真 夠 辛苦 的。|You've really been working hard the past few days.}}

#* {{zh-x|針頭線腦 的|things such as needles and threads}}

#* {{zh-x|這 間 屋子 是 五 米 的 三 米，合 十五 平方米。|This room is five metres by three, or fifteen square metres.}}
#* {{zh-x|兩 個 的 三 個，一共 五 個。|Two pieces and three pieces—there are five in all.}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{hide box|Usage notes|align=left|
* {{sense|possession particle}} {{lang|zh|的}} is usually omitted when referring to a close relationship (family, close friends) or to an institutional or organizational relationship (school, work).
*: {{zh-x|這 是 我 媽媽{ma}|This is my mother}}
*: {{zh-x|這 是 我們 學校|This is our school}}
* {{sense|particle linking a noun and an adjective}} 的 is omitted if it is used with a single-syllable adjective.
*: {{zh-x|壞人|bad person}}
* It must be used when the adjective has more than one syllable or if the adjective is qualified by an adverb.
*: {{zh-x|奇怪 的 人|strange person}}
*: {{zh-x|很 好 的 茶|a very good tea}}
* {{lang|zh|的}} is also omitted when the association is frequent
*: {{zh-x|中國人|Chinese people}}
* The particle {{lang|zh|的}} is referred to as {{zh-l|[[白]][[勺]][[的]]}} to differentiate it from {{zh-l|得*}} ({{zh-l|[[雙]][[人]][[得]]/[[双]][[人]][[得]]}}) and {{zh-l|地*}} ({{zh-l|[[土]][[也]][[地]]}}), although {{lang|zh|的}} may be misused to represent the latter two.}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てき}}
Repurposed from the {{m|en|target}} meaning, probably from [[w:Ming Dynasty|Ming]]- and [[w:Qing Dynasty|Qing]]-era {{der|ja|cmn|sort=てき|-}} use of this character as a possessive or adjectivizing particle,<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> or even earlier in the [[w:Song Dynasty|Song]] and [[w:Yuen Dyanasty|Yuan]] eras.<ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref> Probably also influenced in the {{w|Meiji period}} by the {{der|ja|en|sort=てき|-}} adjective ending {{m|en|-tic}} (as in {{m|en|spastic}}, {{m|en|plastic}}, or {{m|en|characteristic}}), ultimately deriving from {{der|ja|grc|sort=てき|-τικός}}, used to form adjectives from verbs.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref><ref name="SMK5">{{R:Shinmeikai5}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|てき}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|てき}}

# {{l|en|-ive}}, {{l|en|-like}}, {{l|en|-ish}}, {{l|en|-ic}}, {{l|en|-ical}}, {{l|en|-y}}, {{l|en|kind of}}, {{l|en|sort of}}
#: Used to form {{m|ja|形容動詞|tr=keiyō dōshi||''na'' adjectives}} from nouns. The resulting term has a {{m|ja|平板型|tr=heiban-gata||flat type}} or type 0 [[w:Japanese pitch accent|pitch accent]] pattern.
#:: {{ja-usex|中国の雰囲気、中国'''的'''な雰囲気|^ちゅうごく の ふんいき、 ^ちゅうごく-'''てき''' な ふんいき|China's atmosphere, a Chinese '''kind of''' atmosphere}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|てき}}
From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=てき|的|tr=tek|pos=literally “mark in a target”, also meaning “bright”}}.

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|まと}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=まと|-}}. Possibly originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まと|目|tr1=ma|t1=eye|所|tr2=to|t2=place}}. Appears to be {{l|en|cognate}} with {{l|en|homophone}} {{m|ja|円|tr=mato||round|pos=adjective, obsolete in modern Japanese}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

# an {{l|en|objective}}, an {{l|en|object}} {{qualifier|of doing something}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|objective}} {{ja-r|目的|もくてき}}

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いくは}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=いくは|-}}.
* May be derived from rare archaic verb {{m|ja|いくう|tr=ikuu||to shoot [an arrow] at something|pos=archaic spelling {{ja-l|いくふ}}}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>
: The ''ha'' element would presumably derive from the verb ending {{m|ja|ふ|tr=fu}}, which has a {{m|ja|未然形|tr=mizenkei||incomplete form}} of ''ha''. However, this is unlikely, as verb forms ending in ''-fu'' underwent the regular ''f-'' and ''h-'' > ''w-'' shift, which would result in a reading of *''ikuwa'' rather than the correct ''ikuha''.
* The above phonetic discrepancy suggests that ''ikuha'' may instead be a compound of ''iku'' + ''ha''. The ''iku'' element probably derives from root component {{m|ja|いく|tr=iku}} meaning “shooting [arrows]”, as found in {{m|ja|いくう|tr=ikuu}} and also in {{m|ja|戦|tr=ikusa||a battle|pos=original meaning “the shooting of arrows”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The ''iku'' element might be related to verb {{m|ja|射る|tr=iru||to shoot an arrow}}, or obsolete verb {{m|ja|生く|tr=iku||to live; to make something live, to make something go}}, likely {{l|en|cognate}} with {{m|ja|行く|tr=iku||to go}}.
: The ''ha'' element is uncertain. It might be {{m|ja|端|tr=ha||the edge or end of something}}, from the sense “the end [of the arrow's flight]”.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いくは}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いくは}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=いくは|archery|rare}} an {{l|en|archery}} {{l|en|target}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|的所|いくはどころ}}: the {{l|en|location}} where an {{l|en|archery}} {{l|en|target}} is {{l|en|placed}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ゆくは}}
From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=ゆくは|-}}. Alteration of ''ikuha'' above. Compare the ''iku'' <> ''yuku'' alteration in the verb {{m|ja|行く|tr=iku, yuku||to go}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ゆくは}}

====Noun====
